SYSTEM: PROLEGintro_eng_long.pdf: Página 47
Examples of PROLEG semantics(continued)
Example 3 Let P3 = {H3, E3} and H3 be the following set of
rules:
P <=.
and E3 be the following set of exceptions:
exception(P,P).
Let M4 = {P}. Then, since HM4 = {} and M4 ̸= min(HM
4 ), M4
is not an extension.
Let M5 = {}. Then, since HM5 = {P <=.} and M5 ̸= min(HM
5 ),
M5 is neither an extension.
Since there is no other possibility of extension of P2, there is no
extension for P2.
47
speaker: SYSTEM
